case_vignette: A 33-year-old man presents to his primary care physician for fatigue, weight loss, and diffuse pruritus. The patient has a past medical history of multiple admissions for severe abdominal pain and bloody diarrhea as well as several episodes of ascending cholangitis which were successfully treated. He is currently a member of Alcoholics Anonymous. His temperature is 98.2°F (36.8°C), blood pressure is 124/75 mmHg, pulse is 100/min, respirations are 13/min, and oxygen saturation is 99% on room air. Urinalysis is notable only for a dark urine sample with no red blood cells present. A rectal exam reveals pale stool and grossly visible blood. Physical exam is otherwise notable for pruritis, jaundice, and scleral icterus.
question: Which  is the most likely underlying diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Gastrointestinal System. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I'm feeling really tired, I've lost some weight, and I'm itching all over.
Have you noticed any blood in your stools or black tarry stools recently?
Yes, I have noticed some blood when I go to the bathroom.
Final Diagnosis: Gastrointestinal Bleeding.
